titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics Records, 2010-2019 RL.11848
titlestmt.author: Laurin Penland

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-06-03 08:27:01 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics records
did.abstract: Andrej Svorenčik studied theoretical physics and economics in his native Slovakia and social sciences at California Institute of Technology. In 2010 Svorenčik, along with history of economics scholar Harro Maas, organized the Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics at the Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW). The collection documents the activities of the seminar and includes recordings, transcripts, and planning documents. Economists who attended the seminar and who are represented in the collection are: James Friedman, Stephen Rassenti, Frans van Winden, Alvin Roth, Charles Holt, John Kagel, Vernon Smith, John Ledyard, Charles Plott, Elizabeth Hoffman, and Reinhard Selten. In addition the collection includes drafts and proofs of the book that resulted from the seminar and that was edited by Svorenčik and Maas, "The Making of Experimental Economics: Witness Seminar on the Emergence of a Field."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in the original order provided by the creator of the records. Original file titles were kept.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andrej Svorenčik studied theoretical physics and economics in his native Slovakia and social sciences at California Institute of Technology. He defended his dissertation on the history of experimental economics at the University of Utrecht in 2015. In 2010 Svorenčik, along with history of economics scholar Harro Maas, organized the Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics at the Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018 and 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Laurin Penland and Matthew Farrell, May 2020
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2018-0159 and 2020-0051.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Duke Libraries also holds the published book (both a print and online versions) that resulted from the seminar. You can find it by searching the online catalog for: "The making of experimental economics : witness seminar on the emergence of a field," Andrej Svorenčik, Harro Maas, editors.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes recordings, transcripts, and planning documents from the Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics held on May 28 and 29 in 2010 at the Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences. Economists who attended the seminar and who are represented in the collection are: James Friedman, Stephen Rassenti, Frans van Winden, Alvin Roth, Charles Holt, John Kagel, Vernon Smith, John Ledyard, Charles Plott, Elizabeth Hoffman, and Reinhard Selten. In addition the collection includes drafts and proofs of the book that resulted from the seminar, "The Making of Experimental Economics: Witness Seminar on the Emergence of a Field."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection contains electronic records that must be requested and accessed in our reading room. Contact Research Services with questions.

controlaccess.subject: Experimental economics
controlaccess.persname: Winden, F. A. A. M. van (Frans A. A. M.), 1956-

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 70 files in PDF, DOC, DOCX, RTF, XLSX, JPG, and TIF formats. Includes manuscript drafts with comments, proofs, cover and title page photographs, and short bios of participants for the book about the seminar, "The Making of Experimental Economics: Witness Seminar on the Emergence of a Field".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 106 files in DOC, DOCX, PDF, JPG, RTF, and WMA formats. Files include drafts of seminar transcripts with comments from seminar contributors, correspondence about the transcription, notes about editorial choices, and group photographs of seminar participants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 260 files in DOC, DOCX, PDF, and XLSX formats. Files contain budgets, seating plan, permission and authorization forms, timelines, bios, seminar rules, description of what is a "witness seminar," and other documents about the planning, logistics, and organization of the Witness Seminar on Experimental Economics.
